Takeaways from the $355 million civil fr.title: Takeaways from the $355 million civil fraud ruling against Donald Trump
Takeaways from the $355 million civil fr.summary: Judge Arthur Engoron fined Donald Trump $355 million for fraudulently inflating property values, adding to the $83 million defamation fine. The ruling signifies the ongoing civil challenges faced by Trump. Engoron found Trump liable for fraud, conspiracy, and false financial statements, restricting him from serving as a director in NY for 3 years. The judgment also includes fines for profits from property sales, totaling around $438 million in penalties over four weeks.
key_takeaways: Judge Arthur Engoron fined Donald Trump $355 million for fraudulently inflating property values.
Trump fined $438 million in total over four weeks.
Engoron's ruling signifies the significant civil challenges faced by Trump.

NRA trial: Deliberations begin in civil.title: NRA trial: Deliberations begin in civil case against group and top officials
NRA trial: Deliberations begin in civil.summary: The civil corruption trial against the National Rifle Association and its top executives is ongoing, with allegations of mass corruption and misuse of funds for personal expenses.
key_takeaways: The civil corruption trial against the NRA and its executives continues with allegations of misconduct and misuse of funds.
The trial highlights the NRA's spending on private planes, luxury hotels, and other personal expenses.

Caitlin Clark-onomics and the new era of.title: Caitlin Clark-onomics and the new era of profitability in college sports
Caitlin Clark-onomics and the new era of.summary: Caitlin Clark, the all-time leading scorer in women's college basketball, is setting new standards in athlete earnings and marketing power through endorsement deals and NIL agreements. The Supreme Court ruling in 2021 paved the way for college athletes to profit from their personal brand, highlighting women's sports' financial potential and boosting overall interest in collegiate and professional women's sports.
key_takeaways: Caitlin Clark is the all-time leading scorer in women's college basketball, showcasing the growing financial opportunities for athletes through endorsement deals and NIL agreements.

The 2021 Supreme Court ruling allowing college athletes to profit from their personal brand has significantly impacted women's sports, leading to increased revenue, brand recognition, and interest in collegiate and professional women's sports.
